title: Student Attendance Record I
content:
You are given a string representing an attendance record for a student. The record only contains the following three characters:
'A' : Absent.
'L': Late.
'P' : Present.
A student could be rewarded if his attendance record doesn't contain more than one 'A' (absent)

title: Reverse String II
content: Given a string and an integer k, you need to reverse the first k characters for every 2k characters counting from the start of the string. title: Detect Capital
content:
Given a word, you need to judge whether the usage of capitals in it is right or not.
We define the usage of capitals in a word to be right when one of the following cases holds:

title: बंगलौर में बड़े ध्वनि और जोरदार झटके, भूकंप?
content: बैंगलोर के लोगों ने भूकंप की तरह तेज झटके के साथ-साथ किसी तरह की अजीब बड़ी आवाज देखी है। दहशत में आए लोगों ने ट्विटर पर शेयर करना शुरू कर दिया कि उन्हें क्या लगा। बुधवार तड़के करीब 1.25 बजे बैंगलोर में भूकंप के झटके और आवाज महसूस की गई। जब तक हमें सटीक रिपोर्ट नहीं मिलती, तब तक ट्विटर पर कुछ पहली

title: String Compression
content:
Given an array of characters, compress it in-place.
The length after compression must always be smaller than or equal to the original array.

title: Reverse String
content:
Write a function that reverses a string. The input string is given as an array of characters char[].

title: Check If a Word Occurs As a Prefix of Any Word in a Sentence
content:
Given a sentence that consists of some words separated by a single space, and a searchWord.
You have to check if searchWord is a prefix of any word in sentence.
Return the index of the word in sentence where searchWord is a prefix of this word (1-indexed).

title: Number of Segments in a String
content:
Count the number of segments in a string, where a segment is defined to be a contiguous sequence of non-space characters.
Please note that the string does not contain any non-printable characters.
 
Example:
Input: "Hello, my name is John"
